meanings.sent1: I always make sure to pack my baggage carefully before a trip.
meanings.sent2: Her baggage was filled with clothes and toiletries for the vacation.
meanings.sent3: Carrying heavy baggage can make traveling more tiring.
meanings.sent4: His baggage was overflowing with souvenirs from his journey.
meanings.sent5: The colorful baggage stood out on the airport conveyor belt.

meanings.definition: Past experiences or emotions that affect one's current behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her emotional baggage from the past made it hard for her to trust others.
meanings.sent2: Carrying emotional baggage can sometimes hold us back from moving forward.
meanings.sent3: His baggage of old memories sometimes made him nostalgic.
meanings.sent4: Letting go of emotional baggage can feel like a weight lifted off your shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The baggage of past mistakes haunted him in his dreams.

meanings.definition: Unwanted or unnecessary things that weigh someone down.
meanings.sent1: She decided to declutter her life and get rid of all the unnecessary baggage.
meanings.sent2: Carrying emotional baggage can be exhausting and draining.
meanings.sent3: His baggage of worries seemed to disappear after a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent4: Letting go of unnecessary baggage can lead to a sense of freedom.
meanings.sent5: The baggage of negative thoughts was holding him back from happiness.
